title: Out Of The Strings Of A Fiddle, The Melodies Of Cold, Craggy Isles
teaser: The Shetland Islands, a cluster of rocks in the North Sea, is an unusual place. Wealthy from offshore oil, Shetlanders are yet wedded to ancient traditions. And they play the fiddle like no one else.
contentencoded: Copyright 2014 NPR. To see more, visit http://www.npr.org/.
